Valor: Website with all the apps, websites and games that I have developed

Below you have all the work that I have done in my free time, you can browse through apps, webs or even games. Keep in mind that I am not a multi-million dollar company, I am a single person who has developed absolutely everything (including this web you are on).

Here you can see the list of all my free source projects on Github ordered by the date of the last update I have made. Given the volume of code I handle, I'm sorry for not having time to make some proper 'patch notes'.

I could do like most websites and put a huge text only understandable for lawyers and AIs, but I will try to summarize the privacy policy that I have on this website, apps that I develop or even games:
For my part, I do not collect any data that you make use of any of my work, in fact you can see the source code in case you have questions.
But I can't prevent third parties from collecting data, for example, if I upload a game to Steam, Valve will collect data about the game and your use of it.
In the case of pepeizqdeals.com I only store the users who log in. Each user can consult the stored data within their account and can delete their account if they consider it necessary.
In all my projects I do not use Google Analytics or similar services, I do not even use ads for a financing model.

Personally, I think that data collection on the Internet has gotten out of hand thanks to the impunity that large companies enjoy. I am aware that a single developer is not going to change things, but at least I try to be honest with my work.
This project is open source on Github, that means you can take it and do whatever you want with it as long as you respect the license.
It has 0 stars on Github, if you have an account there you can help me professionally by giving me a star.
Website of PC video game deals from official stores

I created this website as a PC video game player who likes to pay their creators for their games, but since I am not a millionaire i needed to be aware of the best deals with a detailed record of each game.
Below I detail the technical capabilities of the website:
The website is automated to always be looking for video game deals, approximately every 4 hours it completes each cycle of looking at deals in all the stores that i have access to.

When a special event occurs, I can generate news on the web. Generally, these news are to inform visitors about temporarily free games, bundles of several games, or new additions to subscription services.
The website is capable of managing individual profiles for tens of thousands of games, within each profile I can edit any game data without having to open the database manually.
I developed this feature for those users who like to receive email notifications of games whose games reach a new minimum price, it also works for new news notifications.

To make it easier to manage a list of desired games, I developed an integration with Steam to import the user's list from there. It also helps me to show the user if they already have the game in various sections of the website.
To reward those users who have helped me with the website at some point I developed this feature, hopefully one day I can do real game giveaways.
App to help manage the website pepeizqdeals.com
I developed this application to automate some functions of the pepeizqdeals.com website that were impossible for me to develop within the website.
Below I explain the functions that the application has:
Given how complicated some social networks can be to announce news on the web, I developed a web browser integrated into the app that would automate the process.
Given the store's security measures and its lack of technical support, it was impossible for me to look at the store's deals on the website, so i had to create an 'ips jumper' to look at the deals.
App to add game Tiles for Windows 10

I developed this application years ago when Windows 10 had Tiles, for those of you who use that version of the operating system the app will still work for you. Although the app is paid, you can use the app for free by downloading the source code and with Visual Studio installed.
Below I detail how it works:
Before adding a Tile to the Start menu, the app can automatically detect what games you have installed on your computer without having to do anything yourself.
Although the app will load default images of the game for the Tile, the user can change them at will or even modify which game the Tile will run.
The app also works on Windows 11, but it is only capable of adding an icon to the Start menu unfortunately.
App to manage a database that I use in other apps

This application only has a single purpose, to manage a database that uses other applications that I have developed. It was more comfortable for me to update the database externally with this app than to update 3 apps manually.
I created a basic interface to see that the different database tables are loaded properly and can be read by other apps.
In order to be able to work from any app or website, the app generates .json files for the various databases.
App to add streaming tv shows and movies Tiles for Windows 10

I developed this application years ago when Windows 10 had Tiles, for those of you who use that version of the operating system the app will still work for you. Although the app is paid, you can use the app for free by downloading the source code and with Visual Studio installed. I also point out that the app only works in the United States, Canada and the countries of the European Union due to an absurd rule of the Microsoft Store.
Below I detail how it works:
Before adding a Tile to the Start menu, the app can search for a series or movie available on the selected platform.
Although the app will load default images of the series or movie for the Tile, the user can change them at will or even modify which game the Tile will run.
The app also works on Windows 11, but it is only capable of adding an icon to the Start menu unfortunately.
App to add Widgets to your games in Windows 11
With the release of Windows 11, a new feature called Widgets appeared. Personally, I don't see it as very useful, but I still developed an app similar to the one I made for the Windows 10 Tiles.
Below I detail how it works:
Before adding a Widget, the app can automatically detect what games you have installed on your computer without having to do anything yourself.
Although the app will load default images of the game for the Widget, the user can change them to their liking or even modify which game the Widget will run.
Due to the little flexibility that Microsoft allows with Widgets, you have to make 2 last clicks to finally add the widget, in the images you can see where.
App to add Widgets to your streaming tv shows and movies in Windows 11
With the release of Windows 11, a new feature called Widgets appeared. Personally, I don't see it as very useful, but I still developed an app similar to the one I made for the Windows 10 Tiles.
Below I detail how it works:
Before adding a Widget, the app can automatically detect what games you have installed on your computer without having to do anything yourself.
Although the app will load default images of the series or movie for the Widget, the user can change them at will or even modify which streaming will run.
Due to the little flexibility that Microsoft allows with Widgets, you have to make 2 last clicks to finally add the widget, in the images you can see where.
App to connect other gaming platforms to Steam

I started developing this app because Playnite seemed absurdly complicated to use, I made it with the sole purpose of 'connecting' to Steam the games that the user had on platforms like GOG or Epic Games in the simplest way possible (nothing more).

It cannot be in the Microsoft Store because they imposed a rule that an app cannot 'need' another app (then they will wonder about the low use of the store by users). So you have the app to download from Github and below I will explain its use:
The app can automatically detect what games you have installed on your computer on various platforms, it is up to you which games you want to add to Steam.
In Steam you will not have to do anything at all, the app already takes care of adding the shortcut of the game you have selected in addition to the corresponding image.
App to check and search game achievement videos on Steam
With this app I intended to keep track of the achievements in my Steam games and watch videos on YouTube about the achievements that I was missing with just a click of the mouse.
Below I detail how it works:
You can add as many Steam accounts as you want as long as they have public permissions to read game data.
The app will load all the games that have achievements in the selected Steam account, and also includes a search engine in case you have a large number of games.
For each game the app generates a list of achievements achieved and those not achieved.
When you click on the achievement, the app will directly load a video on how to obtain the achievement, if it is available on YouTube.
